system.description:
Save Enhancement: Target makes Physical Save against the chosen effect. If you spend AP on multiple effects, the enemy creature will only make 1 Save against all effects.

Save Fail: The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.7470a07f7581c21e.JournalEntryPage.4dd13dd1f69eb979]{Impaired} (DisADV on Physical Checks) on the next Physical Check it makes before the end of your next turn.

vhLIbFadGESEHCtU.name: Impair
vhLIbFadGESEHCtU.description:
Save Enhancement: Target makes Physical Save against the chosen effect. If you spend AP on multiple effects, the enemy creature will only make 1 Save against all effects.

Save Fail: The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.7470a07f7581c21e.JournalEntryPage.4dd13dd1f69eb979]{Impaired} (DisADV on Physical Checks) on the next Physical Check it makes before the end of your next turn.

system.description:
Requirement: Weapons Combat Training

You deal +1 damage against the last creature you Attacked with the Weapon since the start of your last turn.

jOYJQdgpDGiggRpc.name: You Attack the same target
jOYJQdgpDGiggRpc.description:
Requirement: Weapons Combat Training

You deal +1 damage against the last creature you Attacked with the Weapon since the start of your last turn.

system.description:
Save Enhancement: Target makes Physical Save against the chosen effect. If you spend AP on multiple effects, the enemy creature will only make 1 Save against all effects.

Save Fail: The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.7470a07f7581c21e.JournalEntryPage.2507619191ed4878]{Exposed} (Attack Checks against it have ADV) against the next Attack Check made against it before the end of your next turn.

dXqmphpnKuqJTZoy.description:
Save Enhancement: Target makes Physical Save against the chosen effect. If you spend AP on multiple effects, the enemy creature will only make 1 Save against all effects.

Save Fail: The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.7470a07f7581c21e.JournalEntryPage.2507619191ed4878]{Exposed} (Attack Checks against it have ADV) against the next Attack Check made against it before the end of your next turn.

system.description: You regain 1 SP when you perform 1 or more Maneuvers as part of an Action, provided you don’t spend SP as part of that Action.

ZNyQPlISpJwaPXtb.name: Spend Stamina instead of AP
ZNyQPlISpJwaPXtb.description: You can spend SP in place of Action Points when performing a Martial Maneuver.

system.description:
You stand ready for Combat at any moment, granting you the following benefits:

  • Combat Readiness: At the start of your first turn in Combat, you gain one of the following benefits:

    • Brace: You gain the benefits of the Dodge Action and ADV on the next Save you make.

    • Advance: You gain the benefits of the Move Action and ADV on the next Physical Check you make.

  • Second Wind: Once per Combat when you start your turn Bloodied, you can regain 2 HP and 1 SP.

System Tip: Roll this item to trigger Combat Readiness.

N3RDPs5PDSMOJGwh.name: preItemRoll

effects.name: Second Wind
effects.description: Once per Combat when you start your turn Bloodied, you can regain 2 HP and 1 SP.
You have ADV on the next Physical Check you make.
effects.name: Advance

effects.description: You have ADV on the next Save you make.
effects.name: Brace
Dodge
effects.description: You impose DisADV on the next Attack or Grapple made against you before the start of your next turn.

system.description:
Your training in warfare has granted you the following benefits:

  • Weapon Master: At the start of each of your turns, you can freely swap any Weapon you’re currently wielding in each hand for any other Weapon.

  • Maneuver Master: You learn 2 Maneuvers of your choice.

  • Technique Master: You learn 1 Technique of your choice. Once per Combat, when you perform a Technique you can reduce its SP cost by 1.

MqAOGocRZKDahFJA.name: Technique Master
MqAOGocRZKDahFJA.description: Once per Combat, when you perform a Technique you can reduce its SP cost by 1.

effects.name: Technique Master
effects.description:
• Maneuver Master: You learn 2 Maneuvers of your choice.

  • Technique Master: You learn 1 Technique of your choice.

system.description:
You can spend 1 minute observing or interacting with a creature out of Combat (or spend 1 AP in Combat) to learn information about its physical capabilities compared to your own.

Choose one of the following stats of the creature to assess:

  • Might

  • Agility

  • PD

  • PDR

  • HP

Make a DC 10 Knowledge or Insight Check (your choice).

Success: You learn if the chosen stat is higher, lower, or the same as yours.

Requirement: Weapons Combat Training

Your Attacks ignore Shields and 1/2 Cover, and you deal +1 damage against targets that are wielding a Shield or behind 1/2 Cover.

TQBMiKuaVUAszWYo.name: Target using Shield or behind 1/2 Cover
TQBMiKuaVUAszWYo.description:
Requirement: Weapons Combat Training

Your Attacks ignore Shields and 1/2 Cover, and you deal +1 damage against targets that are wielding a Shield or behind 1/2 Cover.

system.description:
Requirement: Weapons Combat Training

You deal +1 damage against a creature if you moved 2 Spaces towards it immediately before making the Attack or if it is on a Mount.

FWqbcPWLkUlgyLet.name: You moved 2 Spaces towards your target
FWqbcPWLkUlgyLet.description:
Requirement: Weapons Combat Training

You deal +1 damage against a creature if you moved 2 Spaces towards it immediately before making the Attack or if it is on a Mount.

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP and 1 SP to attempt to Taunt all enemies within 5 Spaces.

Make an Attack Check, Influence Check or Intimidation Check (your choice) contested by each target’s Mental Save.

Contest Success: Each creature you beat is @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.7470a07f7581c21e.JournalEntryPage.be22f2dd54351826]{Taunted} (DisADV on Attack and Spell Checks against creatures other than you) by you until the end of your next turn.

 

Technique Enhancements

  • Legendary Taunt: (2 SP) Any damage dealt by @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.7470a07f7581c21e.JournalEntryPage.be22f2dd54351826]{Taunted} enemies is halved against any creatures other than you.

FzavvJBZegLwBvUV.name: Legendary Taunt
FzavvJBZegLwBvUV.description: Any damage dealt by @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.7470a07f7581c21e.JournalEntryPage.be22f2dd54351826]{Taunted} enemies is halved against any creatures other than you.

system.description:
Save Enhancement: Target makes Physical Save against the chosen effect. If you spend AP on multiple effects, the enemy creature will only make 1 Save against all effects.

Save Fail: The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.7470a07f7581c21e.JournalEntryPage.a5374646c90ea762]{Dazed} (DisADV on Mental Checks) on the next Mental Check it makes before the end of your next turn.

ARTUfMyMehtuwRqW.name: Daze
ARTUfMyMehtuwRqW.description:
Save Enhancement: Target makes Physical Save against the chosen effect. If you spend AP on multiple effects, the enemy creature will only make 1 Save against all effects.

Save Fail: The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.7470a07f7581c21e.JournalEntryPage.a5374646c90ea762]{Dazed} (DisADV on Mental Checks) on the next Mental Check it makes before the end of your next turn.

system.description:
Heavy Armor is designed with greater attention in protecting the wearer in traditional warfare, requiring extensive combat training to use most effectively. Lamellar, laminar, and plate armor are types of Heavy Armor.

  • Heavy Armor Properties: Heavy Armor has a Might Requirement of 1 with the following properties:

    • The Armor has 1 Physical Damage Reduction (PDR).

    • While wearing the Armor, you have DisADV on Agility Checks.

  • Heavy Armor Mastery: You gain access to Heavy Armor Mastery through certain Class Features or Talents.

  • Metal Armor: All Heavy Armor is considered to be Metal Armor for the purpose of game mechanics (Features, Spells, Weapon effects, etc.) unless otherwise stated.

  • Impactful Unarmed Strikes: Your Unarmed Strikes gain the Impact Weapon Property (+1 damage on Heavy Hits) while wearing Heavy Armor.

Armor Bonus

The higher an Armor’s Quality, the higher the Armor Bonus granted by the Armor, as shown in the table below

Armor Quality

PD Bonus

Novice

+1

Adept

+2

Expert

+3

Requirement: Weapons Combat Training

You deal +1 damage with Melee Attacks against creatures that are farther than 1 Space from you.

YcnNZWdLVmIdteyC.name: Target is farther than 1 Space from you
YcnNZWdLVmIdteyC.description:
Requirement: Weapons Combat Training

You deal +1 damage with Melee Attacks against creatures that are farther than 1 Space from you.

system.description: You can spend 1 AP to make 1 Attack Check.
You can spend 2 AP to become immune to Opportunity Attacks until the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Full Disengage
effects.description: You are immune to Opportunity Attacks until the start of your next turn.

system.description: You can spend 1 AP to impose DisADV on Opportunity Attacks made against you until the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Disengage
effects.description: You impose DisADV on Opportunity Attacks made against you until the start of your next turn.

system.description: You can spend 2 AP to impose DisADV on all Attacks or Grapples made against you until the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Full Dodge
effects.description: You impose DisADV on all Attacks or Grapples made against you until the start of your next turn.

system.description: You can spend 1 AP to impose DisADV on the next Attack or Grapple made against you before the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Dodge
effects.description: You impose DisADV on the next Attack or Grapple made against you before the start of your next turn.

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to attempt to Hide from 1 or more creatures that can’t see you (Unseen).

Make a Stealth Check against the opposing creature’(s) Passive Awareness.

Success: You become Hidden from creatures whose Passive Awareness you beat (making you Unseen and Unheard by them).

You remain Hidden until you make a noise louder than a whisper, make an Attack, cast a Spell with a Verbal Component, or a creature takes the Search Action and successfully locates you.

See @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.37625d2c20f4d3ba.JournalEntryPage.abbf2175525f85e0]{Hidden Creatures} (@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.37625d2c20f4d3ba.JournalEntryPage.2a0a764530aca6af]{Unseen}, @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.37625d2c20f4d3ba.JournalEntryPage.635a365faf844c57]{Unheard}, @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.37625d2c20f4d3ba.JournalEntryPage.699fbe45d7fd755f]{Hidden}) for more on hiding.

When you take the Hide Action and beat an enemy’s Passive Awareness, you only become Hidden from that creature because it can’t see or hear you (you’re both Unseen and Unheard). However, if your Stealth Check beats one enemy’s Awareness Score but not another’s, then you’re Hidden from the first enemy, but you’re not Hidden from the second enemy.

You can spend 1 AP to perform 1 of the following object interactions:

  • Drink a Potion or administer a Potion to another creature.

  • Attempt to lock or unlock a Lock.

  • Make a Trickery Check to activate or disable a trap or other mechanism.

  • Transfer an item to or from another creature (only 1 of the two creatures spends 1 AP).

  • Throw an item to a location you can see up to 5 Spaces away.

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to recall or discern some information about a creature that you can see or hear. Make a DC 10 Knowledge Check.

Success: You learn a piece of lore about the creature.

Success (each 5): You learn 1 creature statistic (PD, MD, Attacks, Abilities, Resistances, Vulnerabilities, Immunities, etc.).
You can spend 1 or more AP to cast a Spell that you know. If the Spell has a Mana Point requirement, you must spend that much MP to cast the Spell.

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to beguile a Beast that can see or hear you. Make an Animal Check contested by the target’s Charisma Save.

Success: The animal is Taunted by you for 1 minute (Repeated Save) or until you target it with a harmful Attack, Spell, or other effect.

Success (5): It’s also Impaired.

Success (10): It’s also Charmed.

effects.description: You have DisADV on Attack Checks against creatures other than the one that Taunted you. If a creature is successfully Taunted while already Taunted by another creature, the original Taunt is removed.

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to attempt to hide an object on yourself or in nearby foliage, debris, or decor to render it Hidden.

Make a contested Trickery Check against the Passive Awareness of creatures that can see you.

Success: The object is Hidden from any creature whose Passive Awareness you beat.

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to discern the course of actions a creature might take on its next turn.

Make an Insight Check contested by the target’s Trickery or Influence Check (its choice).

Success: You learn the target’s emotional state and whether it plans to make an Attack, cast a Spell, or flee combat during its next turn.

Success (5): You know who the creature is likely to target with a harmful ability.

Success (10): You know which ability the creature plans to use.

If the target is a PC, its player tells you what the creature plans to do. If the target is an NPC, the GM tells you what the creature plans to do.

You can spend 1 AP to make a Trickery Check Contested by the target’s Insight Check.

Success: The next Attack against the target before the start of your next turn has ADV and deals +1 damage.

effects.name: Feint
effects.description: The next Attack against you has ADV and deals +1 damage.

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to attempt to intimidate a creature that can see or hear you.

Make an Intimidation Check contested by the target’s Charisma Save.

Success: The target is Intimidated by you until the end of your next turn.

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to uncover a concealed object on a creature, a secret compartment, or the intended function of a mechanism within 1 Space of you.

  • Concealed Objects: You can attempt to uncover any objects concealed on a creature.

    Make an Investigation Check contested by the target’s Trickery Check.

    Success: You know the location of any concealed object on the creature.

  • Secret Compartments: You can attempt to uncover any secret compartments. Make an Investigation Check against the discovery DC of any secret compartments.

    Success: You discover the location of any secret compartments whose discovery DC you beat.

  • Discern Mechanism: You can attempt to discern the functionality of a mechanism (the effect of a trap, how to open a secret door, or activate a device). Make an Investigation Check.

    Success: You learn how the mechanism works and the methods to activate and disable it (if any).

You can spend 1 AP to touch a creature and tend to its wounds.

Make a DC 10 Medicine Check.

Success: You stop its Bleeding or Stabilize it (your choice).

Success (each 5): The creature gains +1 Temp HP.

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to increase the distance you can cover when Jumping. Make a DC 10 Martial Check.

  • Long Jump:

    • Success: You can move 1 additional Space as part of your Long Jump.

    • Success (each 5): +1 additional Space.

  • High Jump:

    • Success: You can move an additional 1ft (30cm) as part of your High Jump.

    • Success (each 5): +1ft (30cm).

You can spend 1 AP to maneuver a mount you’re riding to avoid danger.

Make a DC 10 Animal Check.

Success: The mount’s PD increases by 2 until the start of your next turn.

Success (5): +2 PD.

Success (10): +4 PD.

effects.name: Mounted Defense
effects.description: The mount’s PD increases by 2 until the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Mounted Defense +2
effects.description: The mount’s PD increases by 4 until the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Mounted Defense +4
effects.description: The mount’s PD increases by 6 until the start of your next turn.

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to attempt to move through a Space occupied by a hostile creature that’s within 1 size of you.

Make a contested Martial Check against the target.

Success: You can move through the creature’s Space as if it were Difficult Terrain (Slowed while moving through the area).

Success (5): You can move through the creature's space without it counting as Difficult Terrain.

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to locate 1 or more Hidden creatures and concealed objects within your Line of Sight.

  • Hidden Creatures: You attempt to locate any Hidden creatures in the area. Make an Awareness Check against the Stealth Check of any Hidden creatures.

    Success: You know the location of any Hidden creature whose Stealth Check you beat until the end of your turn. Knowing a creature’s location does not grant you the ability to see it.

  • Hidden Objects: You attempt to locate any Hidden objects in the area. Make an Awareness Check against the DC to discover any concealed objects (such as traps, secret doors, or hidden items).

    Success: You discover the location of any Hidden object whose discovery DC you beat.

Without obstruction, a PC’s line of sight could reach the horizon. You might ask your PC to make their Awareness Check with DisADV to detect a creature that’s far away, such as beyond 10 Spaces.

You can spend 1 AP to grant another creature a d8 Help Die that lasts until the start of your next turn. Upon granting the Help Die, you must declare which creature you’re Helping and the type of Check you’ll be aiding them with while meeting the following conditions:

  • Attack: You declare 1 target for the Attack. You must be within 1 Space of the Attacker or the target of the Attack. While the Help Die lasts, it can be added to an Attack made against the target.

  • Skill or Trade Check: You declare a type of Skill or Trade Check. You describe how you’re Helping them and must do so with a Skill or Trade that you have at least 1 Mastery Level in. You can use the same Skill or Trade or a different one.

The Help Die can only be used to aid the type of Check declared and disappears once it is used.

Multiple Help Penalty: Once you take the Help Action, each time you take the Help Action again before the end of your turn, your Help Die decays by 1 step, to a minimum of a d4 (d8 | d6 | d4). These Help Dice only decay when using the Help Action. Help Die granted by other sources (such as the Sword Maneuver) decay independently of any Help Dice grant through the Help Action.

You can spend 1 AP to move up to your Speed in Spaces (default of 5).

You choose where to move, and can break up your movement by moving before and after taking a different Action.

You can’t end your turn in a Space occupied by another creature.

A creature with 4 AP can take the Move Action to move 1 Space, take the Attack Action, move 1 Space again (2 total Spaces), take the Attack Action again, and then move 2 Spaces again (4 total Spaces).

9hoTUwrRc4hpx0JI.name: preItemRoll

system.description:
Prerequisite: Martial Mastery

Trigger: A creature you can see within your Melee Range uses its movement to leave your Melee Range, stands up from Prone, picks up an item off the ground, or takes the Object Action.

Reaction: You can spend 1 AP to make a Melee Martial Attack against the provoking creature. You can spend additional AP to gain ADV or to perform Maneuvers with the Attack.

Draconic Origin

Choose a Draconic Origin from the list below. All future choices within this Ancestry must use the chosen Draconic Origin. The type of damage associated with your Draconic Origin is your Draconic damage.

  • Elemental Origin: Corrosion, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison.

  • Mystic Origin: Radiant, Psychic, Sonic, or Umbral.

Default Traits

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.3YH1b9nvHlw31AgA]{(1) Darkvision}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.eN1EKDqzMxxZd2A9]{(2) Draconic Breath Weapon}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.HWDwd2Ibf4wK7u3A]{(2) Draconic Resistance}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.7nOCHb3llandPzQJ]{(0) Reptilian Superiority}

Expanded Traits

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.e0Jwk688hdE7uC84]{(1) Concussive Breath}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.cbeNIfxgclOCjjN3]{(1) Draconic Affinity}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.Aq5ZxkvrdFy1mUY0]{(1) Draconic Protection}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.xHe6yaoXcD7C8OLr]{(1) Draconic Ward}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.xODnV7ejV7aEqW3b]{(1) Dying Breath}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.CTV2hAdhkjkJ9qVV]{(2) Glide Speed}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.B5m8I5dOZSgC3Fsn]{(-1) Guardians Bond}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.0UrvejAga4KKNGMr]{(1) Mana Increase}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.p0DQXDC70PZb82yP]{(1) Second Breath}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.gh5h3EAT9FgKwf25]{(1) Thick-Skinned}

eN1EKDqzMxxZd2A9.name: Draconic Breath Weapon
eN1EKDqzMxxZd2A9.description:
You gain a Breath Weapon based on your Draconic Origin. Once per Combat, you can spend 2 AP to exhale in a 3 Space Cone or a 6 Space Line. 

Alternatively, you can choose to make a Spell Attack against a single target within 6 Spaces, increasing the damage by 1.

  • Elemental Breath Weapon: Make a Spell Check against every target's PD within the area.
    Hit: The target takes 2 Draconic damage.

  • Mystic Breath Weapon: Make a Spell Check against every target MD within the area.
    Hit: The target takes 1 Draconic damage.

Before you make your Spell Check, you can spend 1 SP to increase the damage by 1, or 1 MP to increase it by 2.

You can use this ability once between Long Rests. When you Roll for Initiative, or meet some other unique criteria at the GM's discretion, this ability recharges.

HWDwd2Ibf4wK7u3A.name: Draconic Resistance
HWDwd2Ibf4wK7u3A.description: You gain Resistance to your Draconic damage type.

7nOCHb3llandPzQJ.name: Reptilian Superiority
7nOCHb3llandPzQJ.description: You have ADV on Intimidation Checks against reptilian creatures of Medium Size and smaller (not including other Dragonborn).

e0Jwk688hdE7uC84.name: Concussive Breath
e0Jwk688hdE7uC84.description:
Requires: Draconic Breath Weapon

When you use your Draconic Breath Weapon, you can force all targets to make a Physical Save. 

Save Failure: The target is pushed 1 Space away +1 additional Space for every 5 it fails its Save by.

cbeNIfxgclOCjjN3.name: Draconic Affinity
cbeNIfxgclOCjjN3.description: When you take damage of the same type as your Draconic damage, your next Draconic Breath Weapon deals +1 bonus damage.

Aq5ZxkvrdFy1mUY0.name: Draconic Protection
Aq5ZxkvrdFy1mUY0.description: Once per Combat, when an ally within 20 Spaces is on Death's Door, you begin to surge with an ancient power. While they remain on Death's Door their PD and MD increases by 5 till Combat ends.

xHe6yaoXcD7C8OLr.name: Draconic Ward
xHe6yaoXcD7C8OLr.description:
Once per Combat, when you enter Death's Door, you gain 2 Temp HP.

Whenever you’re Hit by a Melee Attack while you have this Temp HP, your Attacker takes 1 Draconic damage.

xODnV7ejV7aEqW3b.name: Dying Breath
xODnV7ejV7aEqW3b.description:
Once per Combat, when you enter Death's Door, you regain a use of your Draconic Breath Weapon and can immediately use it as a Reaction for free.

System TIp: Use that item to trigger that Breat Weapon.

CTV2hAdhkjkJ9qVV.name: Glide Speed
CTV2hAdhkjkJ9qVV.description:
You have a set of wings that you can use to horizontally glide and slow your descent.

Provided you aren't Incapacitated you gain the following benefits while in the air:

  • Controlled Falling: You suffer no damage from Controlled Falling.
  • Altitude Drop: If you end your turn mid air, you controlled fall 4 Spaces.
  • Glide Speed: You can use your movement to glide horizontally.

B5m8I5dOZSgC3Fsn.name: Guardians Bond
B5m8I5dOZSgC3Fsn.description: When an ally enters Death's Door within 20 Spaces of you you take an amount of True damage equal to your Prime Modifier.

0UrvejAga4KKNGMr.name: Mana Increase
0UrvejAga4KKNGMr.description: Your MP maximum increases by 1.

p0DQXDC70PZb82yP.name: Second Breath
p0DQXDC70PZb82yP.description:
You can now use your Draconic Breath Weapon twice per Combat.

Additionally, whenever you use your Draconic Breath Weapon, you can spend 2 uses to increase its damage by 1.

gh5h3EAT9FgKwf25.name: Thick-Skinned
gh5h3EAT9FgKwf25.description: Your PD increases by 1 while you’re not wearing Heavy Armor.

e0Jwk688hdE7uC84.name: Concussive Breath
e0Jwk688hdE7uC84.description:
Requires: Draconic Breath Weapon

When you use your Draconic Breath Weapon, you can force all targets to make a Physical Save. 

Save Failure: The target is pushed 1 Space away +1 additional Space for every 5 it fails its Save by.

cbeNIfxgclOCjjN3.name: Draconic Affinity
cbeNIfxgclOCjjN3.description: When you take damage of the same type as your Draconic damage, your next Draconic Breath Weapon deals +1 bonus damage.

Aq5ZxkvrdFy1mUY0.name: Draconic Protection
Aq5ZxkvrdFy1mUY0.description: Once per Combat, when an ally within 20 Spaces is on Death's Door, you begin to surge with an ancient power. While they remain on Death's Door their PD and MD increases by 5 till Combat ends.

xHe6yaoXcD7C8OLr.name: Draconic Ward
xHe6yaoXcD7C8OLr.description:
Once per Combat, when you enter Death's Door, you gain 2 Temp HP.

Whenever you’re Hit by a Melee Attack while you have this Temp HP, your Attacker takes 1 Draconic damage.

xODnV7ejV7aEqW3b.name: Dying Breath
xODnV7ejV7aEqW3b.description:
Once per Combat, when you enter Death's Door, you regain a use of your Draconic Breath Weapon and can immediately use it as a Reaction for free.

System TIp: Use that item to trigger that Breat Weapon.

CTV2hAdhkjkJ9qVV.name: Glide Speed
CTV2hAdhkjkJ9qVV.description:
You have a set of wings that you can use to horizontally glide and slow your descent.

Provided you aren't Incapacitated you gain the following benefits while in the air:

  • Controlled Falling: You suffer no damage from Controlled Falling.
  • Altitude Drop: If you end your turn mid air, you controlled fall 4 Spaces.
  • Glide Speed: You can use your movement to glide horizontally.

B5m8I5dOZSgC3Fsn.name: Guardians Bond
B5m8I5dOZSgC3Fsn.description: When an ally enters Death's Door within 20 Spaces of you you take an amount of True damage equal to your Prime Modifier.

0UrvejAga4KKNGMr.name: Mana Increase
0UrvejAga4KKNGMr.description: Your MP maximum increases by 1.

p0DQXDC70PZb82yP.name: Second Breath
p0DQXDC70PZb82yP.description:
You can now use your Draconic Breath Weapon twice per Combat.

Additionally, whenever you use your Draconic Breath Weapon, you can spend 2 uses to increase its damage by 1.

gh5h3EAT9FgKwf25.name: Thick-Skinned
gh5h3EAT9FgKwf25.description: Your PD increases by 1 while you’re not wearing Heavy Armor.

system.description: You have a Darkvision of 10 Spaces.

Champions are weapon and armor specialists that push themselves to the limit in combat. They are able to master a wide variety of weapon types and learn their enemies as they fight them.

Source of Power: Champions train intensely to master all types of weapons and armor. They could be outfit in heavy armor and a shield, swing a greatsword with ease, or become a highly trained archer.

 

Starting Equipment

  • 3 Weapons or Shields
  • 1 Ranged Weapon with 20 Ammo OR 3 Weapons with the Toss or Thrown Property
  • 1 set of Novice Light Armor or Novice Heavy Armor
  • X or Y “Packs” (Adventuring Packs Coming Soon)

 

Champion Martial Mastery

Combat Training: Weapons, All Armors, and All Shields

Maneuvers: You learn all Attack Maneuvers. You learn additional Maneuvers as shown in the Maneuvers Known column of the Class Table.

Techniques: The number of Techniques you know increases as shown in the Techniques Known column of the Class Table.

Stamina Points: Your maximum number of Stamina Points increases as shown in the Stamina Points column of the Class Table.

Class Features

Level 1 Class Features

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.classes.Item.blC9lZ8UnSZci4Kz]{Champion Stamina}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.classes.Item.o3A1c3BNoF3vnlwI]{Fighting Spirit}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.classes.Item.lMCeeVziJxm0Ht1f]{Master-at-Arms}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.classes.Item.Ye0XBnNhAcNaUmZ7]{Know Your Enemy (Flavor Feature)}

Level 2 Class Features

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.classes.Item.Kz97WxY1HKvEjY6u]{Adaptive Tactics}

TALENT

blC9lZ8UnSZci4Kz.name: Champion Stamina
blC9lZ8UnSZci4Kz.description: You regain 1 SP when you perform 1 or more Maneuvers as part of an Action, provided you don’t spend SP as part of that Action.

o3A1c3BNoF3vnlwI.name: Fighting Spirit
o3A1c3BNoF3vnlwI.description:
You stand ready for Combat at any moment, granting you the following benefits:

  • Combat Readiness: At the start of your first turn in Combat, you gain one of the following benefits:

    • Brace: You gain the benefits of the Dodge Action and ADV on the next Save you make.

    • Advance: You gain the benefits of the Move Action and ADV on the next Physical Check you make.

  • Second Wind: Once per Combat when you start your turn Bloodied, you can regain 2 HP and 1 SP.

System Tip: Roll this item to trigger Combat Readiness.

lMCeeVziJxm0Ht1f.name: Master-at-Arms
lMCeeVziJxm0Ht1f.description:
Your training in warfare has granted you the following benefits:

  • Weapon Master: At the start of each of your turns, you can freely swap any Weapon you’re currently wielding in each hand for any other Weapon.

  • Maneuver Master: You learn 2 Maneuvers of your choice.

  • Technique Master: You learn 1 Technique of your choice. Once per Combat, when you perform a Technique you can reduce its SP cost by 1.

Ye0XBnNhAcNaUmZ7.name: Know Your Enemy (Flavor Feature)
Ye0XBnNhAcNaUmZ7.description:
You can spend 1 minute observing or interacting with a creature out of Combat (or spend 1 AP in Combat) to learn information about its physical capabilities compared to your own.

Choose one of the following stats of the creature to assess:

  • Might

  • Agility

  • PD

  • PDR

  • HP

Make a DC 10 Knowledge or Insight Check (your choice).

Success: You learn if the chosen stat is higher, lower, or the same as yours.

qrkBxXBYqdsd7rUt.name: Extend Attack
qrkBxXBYqdsd7rUt.description: Your Melee Attack Range is increased by 1 Space (or your Ranged Attack Range is increased by 5 Spaces) for the Attack Check.

UZMUmBv5E3RQGFlx.name: Power Attack
UZMUmBv5E3RQGFlx.description: You deal +1 damage with the Attack. You can use this Maneuver multiple times.

2iRK0FdWRvCPH44g.name: Sweep Attack
2iRK0FdWRvCPH44g.description:
Choose 1 additional target within 1 Space of the original target that’s within your Attack Range.

Make 1 Attack Check against all targets.

Attack Hit: The original target takes your Weapon (or Unarmed Strike) damage, and each additional target Hit takes 1 damage of the same type.

System Tip: Damage type is set to Slashing by default.

MQpSMP9FRuH9d4oQ.name: Chained Style
MQpSMP9FRuH9d4oQ.description:
Requirement: Weapons Combat Training

Your Attacks ignore Shields and 1/2 Cover, and you deal +1 damage against targets that are wielding a Shield or behind 1/2 Cover.

KUMM85xa1Sea4JtZ.name: Crossbow Style
KUMM85xa1Sea4JtZ.description:
Requirement: Weapons Combat Training

You deal +1 damage against the last creature you Attacked with the Weapon since the start of your last turn.

8p8PHs5ddM3ia69L.name: Spear Style
8p8PHs5ddM3ia69L.description:
Requirement: Weapons Combat Training

You deal +1 damage against a creature if you moved 2 Spaces towards it immediately before making the Attack or if it is on a Mount.

RaLHWY6CsDzghUNt.name: Whip Style
RaLHWY6CsDzghUNt.description:
Requirement: Weapons Combat Training

You deal +1 damage with Melee Attacks against creatures that are farther than 1 Space from you.

6JGmfeR778ZnMQox.name: Bleed
6JGmfeR778ZnMQox.description:
Save Enhancement: Target makes Physical Save against the chosen effect. If you spend AP on multiple effects, the enemy creature will only make 1 Save against all effects.

Save Fail: The target begins Bleeding (1 True damage at the start of their turn).

2q82GqvMW0gQGV8b.name: Expose
2q82GqvMW0gQGV8b.description:
Save Enhancement: Target makes Physical Save against the chosen effect. If you spend AP on multiple effects, the enemy creature will only make 1 Save against all effects.

Save Fail: The target becomes Exposed (Attack Checks against it have ADV) against the next Attack Check made against it before the end of your next turn.

tqloff6C4kcnCwWW.name: Impair
tqloff6C4kcnCwWW.description:
Save Enhancement: Target makes Physical Save against the chosen effect. If you spend AP on multiple effects, the enemy creature will only make 1 Save against all effects.

Save Fail: The target becomes Impaired (DisADV on Physical Checks) on the next Physical Check it makes before the end of your next turn.

1dDDAMaCCYzWlN8Z.name: Daze
1dDDAMaCCYzWlN8Z.description:
Save Enhancement: Target makes Physical Save against the chosen effect. If you spend AP on multiple effects, the enemy creature will only make 1 Save against all effects.

Save Fail: The target becomes Dazed (DisADV on Mental Checks) on the next Mental Check it makes before the end of your next turn.

oKuJ9hsPoWPAirjx.name: Side Step
oKuJ9hsPoWPAirjx.description:
Trigger: You are targeted by an Attack against your PD.

Reaction: You move 1 Space to a Space that’s still within the Attack’s range. When you do, the Attack has DisADV against you. If you move behind Cover, you do not gain the benefit of that Cover against the Attack.

2nr63iF95S3bdAtR.name: Swap
2nr63iF95S3bdAtR.description:
You switch Spaces with a willing creature within 1 Space.

If this movement would provoke an Opportunity Attack against you or the target creature, any Opportunity Attacks are made against you.

iNsovu5N4JAAOGKQ.name: Heroic Taunt
iNsovu5N4JAAOGKQ.description:
You can spend 1 AP and 1 SP to attempt to Taunt all enemies within 5 Spaces.

Make an Attack Check, Influence Check or Intimidation Check (your choice) contested by each target’s Mental Save.

Contest Success: Each creature you beat is Taunted (DisADV on Attack and Spell Checks against creatures other than you) by you until the end of your next turn.

 

Technique Enhancements

  • Legendary Taunt: (2 SP) Any damage dealt by Taunted enemies is halved against any creatures other than you.

startingEquipment.weapons: 3 Weapons or Shields + 1 Ranged Weapon with 20 Ammo OR 3 Weapons with the Toss or Thrown Property
startingEquipment.armor: 1 set of Novice Light Armor or Novice Heavy Armor

system.description:
Save Enhancement: Target makes Physical Save against the chosen effect. If you spend AP on multiple effects, the enemy creature will only make 1 Save against all effects.

Save Fail: The target begins @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.7470a07f7581c21e.JournalEntryPage.2f734fbaa3b8881f]{Bleeding} (1 True damage at the start of their turn).

EQkHecVsCDvMsEhZ.name: Bleed
EQkHecVsCDvMsEhZ.description:
Save Enhancement: Target makes Physical Save against the chosen effect. If you spend AP on multiple effects, the enemy creature will only make 1 Save against all effects.

Save Fail: The target begins @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.7470a07f7581c21e.JournalEntryPage.2f734fbaa3b8881f]{Bleeding} (1 True damage at the start of their turn).

system.description:
Trigger: You are targeted by an Attack against your PD.

Reaction: You move 1 Space to a Space that’s still within the Attack’s range. When you do, the Attack has DisADV against you. If you move behind Cover, you do not gain the benefit of that Cover against the Attack.

effects.name: Side Step
effects.description: You move 1 Space to a Space that’s still within the Attack’s range. When you do, the Attack has DisADV against you. If you move behind Cover, you do not gain the benefit of that Cover against the Attack.

system.description:
You switch Spaces with a willing creature within 1 Space.

If this movement would provoke an Opportunity Attack against you or the target creature, any Opportunity Attacks are made against you.

Using a free hand, you can spend 1 AP to attempt to Grapple another creature within 1 Space.

Make an Athletics Check contested by the opposing creature’s Martial Check.

You or the target may have ADV or DisADV on your Check based on each other’s size (see @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.37625d2c20f4d3ba.JournalEntryPage.f38af5c1ca2f3bc3]{Moving & Grappling Creatures}).

Success: The creature is Grappled by you.

  • Dragging: You can move the target to any Space adjacent to you by spending your own Movement to do so. Alternatively, when you move, you can move the target with you, but you’re considered Slowed (Every 1 Space you move costs an extra 1 Space of movement).

  • Ending a Grapple Escape Grapple: The target can spend 1 AP to attempt to free itself from a Grapple. You must make an Athletics Check contested by the target’s Martial Check.

    Failure: The Grapple immediately ends.

  • Incapacitated Grappler: If you become Incapacitated, the Grapple immediately ends.

  • Forced Movement: If an effect attempts to forcibly move the target beyond your reach, you make the Check or Save instead of the target. If the effect targets both you and the target, you make 1 Check or Save for both of you.

    Success: The targets of the effect aren’t moved.

    Failure: The Grapple immediately ends, and the targets of the effect are moved.

  • Falling: If the target begins falling (and you don’t), the Grapple ends if you can’t carry the target’s weight. If you can carry its weight, you hold it suspended in the air.
You deal +1 damage with the Attack. You can use this Maneuver multiple times.

VRugNNjfDkkfbROn.name: Power Attack
VRugNNjfDkkfbROn.description:
You deal +1 damage with the Attack.

You can use this Maneuver multiple times.

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to make an Attack Check Contested by the target's Athletics, Acrobatics, or Trickery Check (target’s choice).

The target has ADV if they’re holding the object with 2 hands. You have DisADV if the target is larger than you. You can’t Disarm a creature that’s 2 Sizes larger than you.

Success: The targeted object falls into an unoccupied space of your choice within 1 Space of the creature.

1XkyhgYVm6NaudJu.name: rollLevelCheck

system.description:
Prerequisite: Spellcasting Mastery

Trigger: When another creature that you can see casts a Spell.

Reaction: You declare a Spell Duel and spend 2 AP and 1 or more MP to challenge the creature with a Spell of your own.You can declare a Spell Duel after the creature makes its Spell Check but before you know the result of its Check.

Choosing a Spell

You declare which Spell you’re using to challenge the opposing Spell, and then describe how you do so using your Spell. The GM decides if that makes sense.

  • Targeted: If your chosen Spell targets 1 or more creatures or objects, you must be able to target the opposing creature or any of its targets with your Spell.

  • Area of Effect: If your chosen Spell covers an area (such as an Arc, Cone, Cube, Cylinder, Line, or Sphere), then your Spell’s Area of Effect must include the opposing creature, any of its targets, or cover an area between the opposing creature and any of its targets.

  • Success & Failure: The success and failure statements of your Spell are replaced by the success and failure statements in the Contest section below.

Contest

The Spell Check the opposing creature makes to cast its Spell is Contested by the Spell Check you make to cast your Spell. When comparing the Spell Checks for the purpose of determining the winner of the Contest, each creature gains a bonus to its Check equal to the MP it spent on its Spell.

  • Success: The target creature’s Spell fails and has no effect.

  • Failure: The target creature’s Spell succeeds and takes effect

  • Tie: The target creature’s Spell fails, has no effect, and you each roll on the @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.roll-tables.RollTable.HxkcpDT6pEOIfYUk]{Wild Magic}. The effect from the table lasts until the end of your next turn.

Whatever the result, each creature still spends all AP, MP, or other resources they spent to cast their Spell.

Multiple Participants: Additional creatures can choose to participate in helping the Spell take effect or participate in stopping the Spell from taking effect. If multiple creatures choose to participate in the Spell Duel, the participants are sorted into Initiators (those trying to help the Spell take effect) and Challengers (those trying to prevent the Spell from taking effect). During the Contest (see further below), every participant makes their Spell Check and the highest Initiator result is compared against the highest Challenger result to determine the outcom.

r9dCdRmbQ6lLsJ8l.name: preItemRoll

system.description:
You gain a Breath Weapon based on your Draconic Origin. Once per Combat, you can spend 2 AP to exhale in a 3 Space Cone or a 6 Space Line. 

Alternatively, you can choose to make a Spell Attack against a single target within 6 Spaces, increasing the damage by 1.

  • Elemental Breath Weapon: Make a Spell Check against every target's PD within the area.
    Hit: The target takes 2 Draconic damage.

  • Mystic Breath Weapon: Make a Spell Check against every target MD within the area.
    Hit: The target takes 1 Draconic damage.

Before you make your Spell Check, you can spend 1 SP to increase the damage by 1, or 1 MP to increase it by 2.

You can use this ability once between Long Rests. When you Roll for Initiative, or meet some other unique criteria at the GM's discretion, this ability recharges.

dZugHRpXDKjabEPC.name: Attack only one target
dZugHRpXDKjabEPC.description: You can choose to make a Spell Attack against a single target within 6 Spaces, increasing the damage by 1.

nwFznURecEffIIve.name: Spend Stamina
nwFznURecEffIIve.description: Before you make your Spell Check, you can spend 1 SP to increase the damage by 1.

maxdUGPkaTfPMixb.name: Spend Mana
maxdUGPkaTfPMixb.description: Before you make your Spell Check, you can spend 1 MP to increase it by 2.

kB4GSDZI64LnbxVw.name: onCreate

jnWIr3ZrexNsHSk1.name: onDemand

system.description: You have ADV on Intimidation Checks against reptilian creatures of Medium Size and smaller (not including other Dragonborn).
Your Melee Attack Range is increased by 1 Space (or your Ranged Attack Range is increased by 5 Spaces) for the Attack Check.

DniRroDDquppaVpi.name: Extend Attack
DniRroDDquppaVpi.description: Your Melee Attack Range is increased by 1 Space (or your Ranged Attack Range is increased by 5 Spaces) for the Attack Check.

system.description:
Choose 1 additional target within 1 Space of the original target that’s within your Attack Range.

Make 1 Attack Check against all targets.

Attack Hit: The original target takes your Weapon (or Unarmed Strike) damage, and each additional target Hit takes 1 damage of the same type.

System Tip: Damage type is set to Slashing by default.

hefBlhRCldpMVgEC.name: Sweep Attack
hefBlhRCldpMVgEC.description:
Choose 1 additional target within 1 Space of the original target that’s within your Attack Range.

Make 1 Attack Check against all targets.

Attack Hit: The original target takes your Weapon (or Unarmed Strike) damage, and each additional target Hit takes 1 damage of the same type.

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to attempt to push a creature within 1 Space of you. Make an Athletics Check contested by the target’s Martial Check.

Success: You push the creature 1 Space away from you or to its left or right.

Success (each 5): Push up to 1 additional Space.

Knock Prone: After the result, you can choose to reduce the total distance the target is pushed by 1 Space to knock them Prone instead.
You gain Resistance to your Draconic damage type.

But6fLIt8gDsPstS.name: onDemand

ifamcuRvInaOOOA1.name: onCreate

effects.name: Draconic Resistance
effects.description: You gain Resistance to your Draconic damage type.

system.description:
If you move at least 2 Spaces in a straight line, you can spend 1 AP to attempt to Tackle a creature that’s your size or smaller.

Make an Athletics Check contested by the target's Martial Check.

Success: You Grapple the target and you both move 1 Space in the same direction you were moving then immediately fall Prone.

Success (each 5): +1 Space moved.
